Reviews.Title: “I have spent wonderful days in this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: annavacsi
Reviews.Content: I have spent wonderful days in this hotel. It is really close to the tourist attractions of the city. The rooms are nice and clean. The staff is helpful and kind. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “"A wonderful hotel in Istanbul"”
Reviews.Author: maysa a
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. Everything is there (historical sites, bazaars, souvenir shops, cafes). The staffs were very helpful. The room is warm, cozy and very clean. Really great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Nic0la_6
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable & so close to everything-Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia & Basilica Cistern. I don't think it's a 4 star hotel but our room was kept very clean, the staff were really friendly & the breakfast was nice (they do cereal & toast as well, which is handy!). Our room was at the front, nearest to a mosque so we took ear plugs with us & were only half-woken with the call to prayer a couple of times during the week we were there. The roof terrace is really nice & you can sit up there anytime & watch the sunset, that was a bonus. The street the hotel's in is very busy & can be a bit loud but you can close the windows & put the A/C on to block out the noise & we both slept fine really. This hotel is so close to everything (approx 10 mins walk from most places) and reasonably cheap so we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: FerryRO
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small but very clean. Is in the heart of Istanbul, close to most points of interest. Staff very helpful (they gave us very useful information). I did not gave 5 points this hotel for one reason, in the room could hear neighbors (talking or laughing) and people who were in the halls. Very poor sound insulation.

Reviews.Title: “May Hotel more likely to labelled as 2 Stars Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seriously2011
Reviews.Content: We spent couple of days in the May Hotel, it is located on a steep hill to take the tram, cab, historical center and all tourist attractions. - We arrived in the evening exhausted and we have been given some beds quite uncomfortable so that made for not such great sleep, it was a tiny double room with a tiny wardrobe [so we have nowhere to put our luggage]. The shower was also extremely tiny. In addition to that the worst was that the noise and the room maintenance: - May hotel is located on a very busy street with factories also working 24 hours, so noise was continuously hear. We did request a quiet room the next day but nothing has been done and ''according'' to the receptionist the hotel was fully bookedâ€¦ - The room was not properly well maintained as it was full of dirt and dust underneath and around the beds. Problem was often brought to the attention of the front desk, staffs and cleaner but nothing been solved. We will not book again at this hotel, do not advice for people looking for comfort and good room.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok, but......................”
Reviews.Author: Emzkhan
Reviews.Content: Hotel stay was very good, really enjoyable, It's located near all the great attractions and the staff were very friendly. The hotel is loacted on a steep hill but wasn't much of a big deal, I walked everywhere, never had to take the tram or cab. A one thing, in my opinion will make this place very good or excellent. You get will ripped off most of the time when you buy anything in Istambul and it will be helpful if the staff can give more advice and help on prices. 1) I took a taxi from Ataturk airport to the hotel and it cost me 30 lira (on the meter). When I needed to go back to the airport, I asked the hotel receptionist how much it would cost for their private transfer service for the journey. The guy I spoke to said 50 lira. Later in the day I asked another receptionist later the same question, he said it would cost 55 lira, "but he would do it for 50" making it sound like he was "doing me a favour" He said that a normal Taxi fair would cost 40 lira and I knew it only costs about 30 lira. I didn't make a fuss as I could be asked to haggle or dispute the cost. The taxi guy came in the morning, didn't put his meter on and he quoted 40 lira, at this point I just felt sad and just paid this amount. I know we are tourists, but not made of money!! 2) Water is a necessity!!! And they don't provide water for free - Fair enough they want to charge for water but charging 3 lira for a small bottle (250ml) from the mini bar I thought was extortionate when you can buy a small bottle of water outside for as little as half a lira and a big bottle (2) litre for 1 lira? A little bit of extra help will go a long way and if these things are taken into consideration, I think this hotel will be a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Zalobeidi
Reviews.Content: This isa small quaint nicely located hotel. If you want luxury then go to a five star one. If you are looking for a good value hotel with clean rooms, great service, friendly staff and a homely atmosphere with a large selection in the buffet breakfast then this should be your choice. We really enjoyed our stay with a 3 minute walk to the tram way street and the Grand Bazaar. Very close to the historical centre and all tourist attractions. We will definately stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “No sleeping in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helena_Parker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights in the end of May 2011. When you come to the hotel, they will to sell you a map of central Istanbul (5TL) without asking you if you need it, they gave it to us and after marking on the map where we are staying they demanded 5 Turkish Lira for it. It is not the cost I am complaining about (they rip off tourists everywhere), but the very principal of selling me what I do not need (I had my maps with me), but ended up having to pay for additional map. We arrived in the evening and they gave us a room on a ground floor. It was very tiny double room with very tiny wardrobe (not big enough for 2 people), nowhere to put suitcase (and we had only one suitcase!), so we put it on top of the wardrobe. But it was not the worst point. The worst was that the noise was terrible, we felt like we were put to sleep on the street (windows were facing very busy street with people walking up and down and lots of factories working 24/7 (with night shifts), so noise was really (and I mean REALLY) loud (and we did request a quiet room in our reservation form). The bathroom was small, but the shower was a joke, you can hardly squeeze in it (and I am UK size 8!!!). You definitely cannot move in it, it is like standing coffin. I went to request another room. Receptionist said that it can be arranged, but next day after 12pm, as the hotel was fully booked. I was not happy, as I could not unpack, because we were changing room next day. However, we did not have a choice. Next day we got a room on top floor with a small balcony (only top floor rooms have balconies in this hotel, 1 person can use it at the time, no space for chair or small table on it, you can just stand there alone and look around). Room was hardly better (apart from balcony), but the noise was just the same! So we understood that we will be stuck in this noise for all 8 days of our holiday. Windows were facing factory windows, so it was noisy at all times. Roof terrace was nothing special, again facing factory windows and a small bit of Marmara Sea). And the "icing of the cake" was that there is a mosque few meters away from hotel, and mosque's minarets with its speakers face the hotel! Therefore, every few hours there was a 10-minutes long call for prayer - extremely loud. I could not believe it. The 1st call for prayer is at 5am every day. You are guaranteed to be woken up, as the noise is as loud as in rock concert! So forget about any sleep there... We literally could not sleep well a single night. Maybe it is like this everywhere in Istanbul hotels, I donâ€™t know, as mosques are everywhere and cover all area of Istanbul. The location of the hotel was quite good - 20 min walk (or 5 min by Tram) to Sultanahmet old town centre with Blue Mosque in it and 25 min walk to Aya Sofia, 7 min walk to Tram stop "Beyazit" (Tram costs 1,75TL for a plastic coin-like jeton for single tram journey, you can buy them from the machine just by the tram stop). You can only pay with Turkish Liras in Istanbul (unlike seaside Turkish resorts, where you can use other currencies, too). Hotel is also 8-10 min walk to Grand Bazaar (and the tram takes you to Blue Mosque, Eminonu Port (where you will take your Ferry for Bosforus river cruise (25TL each) or visit Spice Bazaar (nice for buying spices, tea, nuts and dried crandberries), Spice Bazaar starts near Eminonu as well); please note that the walk to the tram stop and Grand Bazaar is up very steep hill, which was not a big problem for me, but if you are not very sporty and fit, it might be quite a challenge). Fish restaurants (quite a rip-off) are downhill from hotel (3 min walk), and they are open until late, we had dinner after 10pm. So location is convenient for touring Istanbul despite all the noise from factories, which are everywhere (including in adjacent houses from hotel). These factories produce shoes and leather goods and accessories for bags, belts, shoes, etc... By the way, I wanted to buy shoes in the area, as below factories there are normally shoe shops (all over the place near hotel), but they sell shoes only in big boxes, in packs of many (for other traders), so in most of shops you cannot buy a single pair of shoes, despite of nice display of single pairs of shoes. They are displayed for traders, not individual buyers. In order to get to hotel from Sabiha GÃ¶kÃ§en Airport, we took Havas bus to Taksim Square (costs 14 TL each), and from there we took a cab to hotel (he was going in circles and could not find the hotel, and the payment is counted by the meter), 25TL for taxi from Taksim Square to hotel. So have some Turkish Lira with you, you cannot pay with other currency even for your bus or taxi from airport. Breakfast (buffet-style) in a hotel was very poor (served from 7am to 10:30am every morning), stale bread and processed cheap meat, fresh oranges (which was probably the best part of it), tea/coffee, fresh cucumbers and tomatoes, nothing much, every day the same stuff. The waiter was rather rude, harassing us for tips every single morning (it is self service there, so I don't know why he thought he deserved a tip). Istanbul itself is a fantastic city and I enjoyed it every minute, there is a lot to see and do. istiklal Caddesi (near Taxim Square) is the best street for going out at night - shops, clubs, restaurants, busy and lively street, especially at weekend. We found a few live music venues on a Friday night - very good! I loved this magical city despite of a little disappointment from hotel disadvantages.

Reviews.Title: “very good service, clean, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: daniel_osorio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of march 2011. The hotel looks new, the rooms are clean, normal-sized and nice. It has a nice balcony overlooking the Marmara, and it is also very cheap for Istanbul standards. The service was very good from everyone in the hotel, and the breakfast they provide is also good. There is a tram station 400 mts away (Beyazit) but you have to consider that the hotel is in a very steep hill, so it can be exhausting for some people. The neighbourhood is working class but it felt safe and we did not have any problem. The only real problem of the hotel is that rooms are very noisy as walls are very thin, almost like sharing the same room with other people. At the same time, a lot of noise from the street is filtered through the windows and balcony. We had to use earplugs to be able to sleep. If you can manage to use them, or can sleep with noise, we definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service & Great Value For Money!!!”
Reviews.Author: afu_q
Reviews.Content: I stayed there over 4/5 days and the service provided by the staff was excellent, they all spoke good English and always willing to provide assistance. The hotel location is reasonable, approx 20 mins walk from the main attractions of Istanbul ( The Blue Mosque or Sultanahmet, Topkapi Palace, The Grand Bazaar & Hagia Sophia). The room size is very good, and the service provided are up to good standard. Taxis & Trams are running very close by on a regular basis, plenty of money exchange places and restaurants, tea shops etc. I will most certainly be going back and would recommend May Hotel to all my friends. Asif Qureshi UK

Reviews.Title: “Not a swanky, posh hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: BuckleburyJules
Reviews.Content: very clean and good for a few nights. We were in the only three bedded room - on the small side and on the ground floor which probably made for more noise, but how long do you spend in your room on a sightseeing weekend? Just take earplugs. Breakfast was good and lcocation didn't bother us - 3 women. It is a working area - lots of shoemakers - and there are lots of men around but we never felt threatened. Indeed, all locals went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. Easy walking distrance of all sights, as long as you can manage it up steep hill to start with! No good if you have walking difficulties. Pavements are also very uneven. Only a couple of hundred yards to all the fish restaurants in Kumkapi. Overall, a good, clean, friendly budget choice for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “A BAD CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: danial32
Reviews.Content: it is notI a 4 star hotel it should be a 2 strar. very bad location, not a touristic area, you dont feel safe to go out after dark. hotel is very far from transport and tram. it's look like you are living in a mumbay slum.very small and uncomfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The good reviews were correct”
Reviews.Author: ebacher28
Reviews.Content: Only good feelings about this hotel. Very friendly people and a comfy, clean room looking out over the street. Loved being so close to the mosque and hearing the magical call to prayer each morning. Nice authentic neighborhood. This is a great bargain hotel!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: semucosss
Reviews.Content: i was in istanbul for a business trip, and never seen such a friendly staff, excellent view and atmosphere like this hotel before...

Reviews.Title: “Caravan = May Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roger123321
Reviews.Content: People I do not want scare you from going to this hotel because if you have never stepped inside a nice clean comfortable Caravan then this is your chance to do so. Donâ€™t be influenced by the good comments on TripAdvisor because honestly there is lots more to discover when you get there. Bad things about May Hotel This hotel is just like a Caravan looks good but it is totally pants. Firstly its very small like a caravan. The walls are so thin you can hear people when they fart next door, when they have sex, even when turning on the bed. You can even hear when the lift doors open. On each floor there are 6 rooms. We were first given a room on the 2nd floor but after a horrific night listening neighbours having drink and sex I complained to the manager about the level of noise from next door he then changed our room to the top floor right at the back. Even then I could hear people next door and the lift opening even when the door is shut. The rooms are so small that even Travelodge in UK has spacious and cleaner rooms. All rooms are shower only and its so small that its only suitable for kids. I am not kidding this is true. The sink is so small you can only wash your hand and not your face. If you are not too bothered about Noise, room size, comfort then you have hit the jack-pot welcome to May caravan hostel. Good Thing: The bed does not squeak, shower is powerful but so close to the ceiling that a single splash will touch the electrical circuit resulting in death. Room service is good. Breakfast is satisfactory. Although the location is good you have to climb high to get to the tram line. Itâ€™s like climbing Mount Everest. If you like going up hill then this is the best for you. The surrounding area is full of leather shoes whole sellers and there are many small gambling/bars where you will find lots of old men waiting to perv on you if you are a lady. This hotel is in the heart of perv land. Honestly if you have Â£10 extra I would recommend you to look for a better hotel because the review people have given for this hotel in TripAdvisor is very misleading. Or alternatively you can go book this hotel and find out yourself.

Reviews.Title: “unfogetable place to stay after my home”
Reviews.Author: manal054
Reviews.Content: evry time i visit istanbul,i choose may hotel to stay in. Very clean and safe hotel, located close to all historical and tourest places. i dont feel my self in istanbul unless i visit this hotel as apart of the journey.thanks for he wonderfull staff and the owner of it

Reviews.Title: “Wounderful Location and great stay”
Reviews.Author: zhusary
Reviews.Content: Close from everything you need from shopping to visiting sites and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, friendly hotel. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Arry001
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean room, although quite small. We were only there for one night, but the room was perfectly adequate. Quite noisy early in the morning. Excellent location for good fish restaurants and easy walking distance to the Grand Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “recommended both for family vacation and business trip”
Reviews.Author: TheodoraYordanova
Reviews.Content: In the beginning of December I was on a business trip to the city. A colleague of mine recommended the hotel , for he had already stayed there and had been very happy with this choice. Upon my arrival , it turned out that he did rightly so â€“ the place is located very favourably (close to essensial tourist spots with good communication), has a parking space , the rooms are comfortable and guaranteed clean, staff are always friendly and they gave us support to city navigation and common issues. If I have the chance to visit Istanbul as a tourist I would not hesitate to book in the May Hotel , and though I was travelling by business , I would like to recommend the place for family vacations also. Hope to be able to come again

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ruhi23
Reviews.Content: Situated in Sultanhamet, the hotel is well placed within easy reach of all the sites. It is also a short distance away from all the fish restaurants in Kumpaki. A short walk up a steep hill and you get to Beyazit tram station where you can catch a tram to Eminomu for the Bosphorous cruise. The hotel is clean and the staff especially the manager very friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was basic but fresh. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEDED OUR EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: ronwalker98
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel which exceeded expectations. The rooms were a good size very clean and comfortable, staff went out of their way to be helpfull. The location could not have been better io minute walk in one direcion and you are in the middle of all the main places of interest -The Grand Bazzar, The blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace ect., 5 minute walker in the other direction and you are surrounded by the finest fish/reafood resturaunts you can imagine and for the ladies you are bang in the middle of the Istanbul's Shoe/leather district.

Reviews.Title: “An ideally situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: jip75
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at the May for a week in November. We thought it ideally situated in an interesting area, with courteous and friendly staff, compact but clean, light and airy rooms, fresh, tasty breakfasts (lovely coffee) and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean!”
Reviews.Author: jeva72
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights in Hotel May.The rooms arent big, but after the all days sightseeing its enough The clean was excellent, everyday was freshly new washed towels.the beds are really comfortables. The staff was really very helpfully!!! The breakfasts are simples,but all is fresh! So, its OK with very good price :)

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, but still off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: roxiestone
Reviews.Content: Just finished a weeklong stay at the May. I would stay there again. As others have said, the rooms are small, but immaculate. The staff very friendly and helpful and I found the morning breakfast to be quite nice. The hotel is in a working neighborhood, which I found interesting and it is on a very steep street. You will, as others have said, have to walk in the street at times, but all of this adds to the experience. And yes, the mosque is close, but I didn't find it too loud. I would also recommend the Sip Sak Balik Lokantasi restaurant just a couple of blocks down the street. Wonderful meals at a great value.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: elkland
Reviews.Content: The almost brand new May Hotel is a gem right in the most colorful section of Sultanhamet. Just four blocks down the hill is the Bosporous and Kumkapi train station, where a $1 jeton takes you right to the main train station. Also down the hill there, a bunch of very nice fish restaurants on a quiet square. The hotel is spotless, the staff incredibly helpful, the breakfast good. Rooms are small and lack a chair, but there is a small stool. Bathrooms are shiny! What more does one need in a vibrant city like Istanbul?

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AlinaSlavici
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and clean. Friendly and helpful staff. Location is great for the city and for some of the city's major ports.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielyan
Reviews.Content: Located in the old part of Istanbul, close to many restaurants and attractions. Very friendly ready to help with any even the most minor problem. Impressions from the hotel after 3 nights the most good.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, nereby grand bazaar”
Reviews.Author: omirka
Reviews.Content: we stayed 6 nights at may hotel. the location is a bit dark and shabby, since it is a district with lots of small shoes workshops, working until late hours (almost till midnight every night), but it is not dangerous and we did not feel any uncomfort walking late in the night. the rooms are nice and clean, not very big. first night we had a room facing the street, but since the craft workshops work that late, the garbage trucks were very loud. and then at dan the muezzin was also very loud :( we asked for a room on the back side and had no problems with sleep any more :) we would recommend this hotel to people who do not care about the location or do not need any luxury, but to have a nice place to sleep and who want to walk to the grand bazaar, the hagia sofia and other monuments in sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: manal054
Reviews.Content: thanks for the owners of the hotel and the managers for evry thing. i spent excellent vacation because of the great service,quite,clean,calm ,and friendly faces of imployers in the hotel.i hope i can find a chance to repeat this nice hotel vacation.

Reviews.Title: “so nice”
Reviews.Author: ibw20002002
Reviews.Content: clean & good room service & good locaation & good brakfast

Reviews.Title: “thanks for all”
Reviews.Author: fatmaal_mufatesh
Reviews.Content: thank you all for your services which makes us so happy and we enjoied in every minite in istanbul and im so glad to chose your hotel. relly thank you for evry body thier

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, staff was very nice!”
Reviews.Author: apassengerpigeon
Reviews.Content: After staying in a few hotels that didn't live up to thier Internet names, we were so happy after our stay at the May. The rooms felt modern, the staff was great, the breakfast buffet got us up and running. The rooms are small and the walls are thin-don't be surprised, but everything about the hotel including it's location and very friendly staff made us feel welcomed. We were so happy with our experience at the May!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel: friendly, clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: Matthew_Blackett
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel, ideal for a city break in Istanbul. Staff were VERY friendly, location is great for the city and for some of the city's major ports, and rooms are modern, clean, bright and airy. 100% recommend a stay here. Price was good and breakfast substantial.

Reviews.Title: “Wery nice”
Reviews.Author: Drobizek
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with nice staff. The street on whitch the hotel is possitioned shows the actual Istanbul and for that it gives it a special touch. Not far from the great fish restaurants and to the tram near the Grand bazzar on the other side. Also great strartpoint for all the other historic and monumental visits. Great roof terrace at night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pleasure , Awesome Experience !”
Reviews.Author: Majero
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel not knowing what to expect . But it totally surprised me . The place is really great and near to the important stuff in Istanbul. The staff is really helpful and friendly all the time. and at night, you will get a comfortable quiet sleep ! The hospitality is really great and when you want to relax, you can always go on the top floor and enjoy the great view of the sea and the old city and just relax under the sun. ' I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone who would like to enjoy the experience of the great city of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “total rip-off....but the staff are nice.”
Reviews.Author: missN28
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the glowing reviews here...I loved the city, but staying here totally ruined it for me.....the room was tiny, the bathroom dirty and like a throw back from the 80's, and the views from my window overlooked noisy sweatshops (i took photos because i was so shocked, get in touch if you want to see!) . The walls were paper thin, the air conditioning either too hot or too cold. The breakfast was crap- just a selection of stale bread and cold processed ham and some melon...what exactly does the chef do?..I have Turkish friends who live in the area and they showed me what I could've got for my money- so gutted. I was absolutely shocked to be charged over 200TL (about Â£90) for a handful of LOCAL phone calls- it would've been cheaper to call international from my UK mobile! Come on- that's just ridiculous! And there is noway you will win an argument here, don't even try! I have a feeling some of these reviews are manufactured and not totally genuine....I have stayed all over Europe, sometimes in very budget hotels and even hostels which look like the Hilton in comparison to this! I would encourage everyone to visit Istanbul, its amazing, but please book elsewhere as staying here almost ruined it for me! Also, this hotel is in an obscure backstreet which means anything you saved on getting a room, will only be spent on taxis taking you in circles as they try to find this. The only redeeming factor for this hotel is the friendly and helpful staff on front desk and the lovely cleaning ladies- apart from that look around, you will be able to get better hotels for the same amount you pay here. I am going back to Istanbul, but there is no way i will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for buck”
Reviews.Author: calkenneth
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel rooms, decent location, decent breakfast, and decent price. This is not a luxury hotel but it was never meant to be. It's good value for money. Not much to complain about (although I wish they'd wipe the toilet rim clean when they cleaned the bathrooms) but I do think they should staff the upstairs roof if they say they will. We went up there a few times expecting a nice place to relax, grab a turkish coffee, drink a beer... to no avail. Oh, and about our check-in process. We made arrangements via email and asked for a room that could fit 4 people (3 beds). They guaranteed us the room but when we arrived, they told us that they could only give us two separate rooms with 1 bed in each room. Luckily we were able to work it out, but it kind of sucks to be told one thing via email and then be sold another thing. We did not have to pay for the extra room though so that was a plus: two bathrooms, more space. The front desk night clerk was great - he was very friendly, sociable, and really gave us a taste of what the locals are like.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, close to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: oanah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at May Hotel for 6 nights. I recommend it for everyone. The room was tiny but clean, the breakfast was good, and the staff was very friendly. I didnâ€™t care about the mini bar, but I liked the big safe box. The bed was very comfy and I loved the cotton linen. :) The only issue is that the walls are very thin, but all the buildings in the old area are the same. Buy some ear plugs and youâ€™ll sleep like a baby. I had it and I didnâ€™t hear any noise. Without, youâ€™ll hear the sound of the AC from next door or the prayer at 5 oâ€™clock in the morning. WI - FI worked fine. It is very close to all major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a Boutique Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Moose-groupie
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I chose this hotel for our stay in Istanbul after reading all the great reviews on Tripadvisor. However, we were extremely disappointed and the hotel certainly didnâ€™t live up to the expectations we had after reading all the other reviews. I even began to wonder whether we had turned up at the wrong hotel but as they picked us up from the airport and had our reservation suspected not! The room was tiny, which could either be freezing with the a/c on or boiling hot with the a/c off. The size of the bathroom was a joke and it wasnâ€™t very clean either. The hotel was also very noisy with paper thin walls and loud staff. The view out of our bedroom window was out the back of the hotel onto which I can only describe as a â€œsweatshopâ€�. And the great breakfast we kept reading about was average at best. The staff were very friendly, especially at check-in but this hotel is not the â€œbest hotel in Istanbulâ€� as claimed by some on Tripadvisor or the Boutique Hotel it promises to be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, I would definitely recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: plachanc
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in this hotel with two friends and I would definitely recommend it. The room was small but very clean, the beds comfortable and the staff very helpful. Very good cleaning staff. The location is also very good, 15 minutes walking to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. In two words : Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel's response to roll over accident during airport transfer: Charge them more!”
Reviews.Author: firetheinferno
Reviews.Content: Staying in the hospital in Istanbul for two nights with my wife after a 80 kph roll-over crash during the free airport to hotel transfer (the other car's fault, and seatbelts save lives), I was looking forward to writing a glowing review about the response of the May Hotel, despite what a terrible event occurred. However, it cannot be so. Immediately after arrival from the hospital the proprietor continued the same story he'd told on the phone: that his transport service said we didn't show up, and that the crash had nothing to do with him since we went off with an unknown driver. But my wife and I simply found the only driver holding our name on a sign in the airport, and he already knew where we were going, and didn't ask for money or anything. I suspect that we got traded between drivers, but whatever happened the guy had our name, he had a decent car, and the accident was the other car's fault. . . But here we were arriving at the hotel, being told by the manager I thought was going to take care of us for the next two days that this was my fault for not showing up for the transfer (?!?). And it didn't stop there. . . I admit, I arrived at the hotel after my hospital stay with a broken sternum expecting to be given special treatment. Maybe an upgraded room? Or not to have to pay mini-bar rates for water as I recovered? But instead it became apparent that our gracious host had smelled desperation, and thus, an opportunity for profit. "Oh, can't check out during the day ahead of your evening flight because you're too weak from your accident to tour all day? Too bad, you'll have to pay for an extra night for those six hours." "Oh, can't take the metro to the airport because you can't lift your bags? Our shuttle will be 50 TYL, payable cash only." "Oh, you lost your lonely planet guide book in the accident? Here take this map, only 5 TYL." I actually had to convince the guy that the ride they gave us from the hospital to the hotel should count as the original free airport transfer, since the first one crashed! But my arguing was limited there due to my shock and weakened state. On checkout day I gave a goodwill offer to pay half of the full room rate for our late checkout which he declined because it was too late to re-rent the room. I had naively assumed that both ourselves and the hotel were partner victims in a crash caused by another crazy driver, but it turned out the hotel was quite happy for us to be the only victims. I have no legal complaint against the hotel, and in the end we paid what we had to in order to protect our health and recovery. But realize that when you stay here I've illustrated what kind of hospitality you receive. Oh, and I'd recommend against rooms on the fourth floor: directly opposite the a minaret speaker's blaring, distorted call to prayer.

Reviews.Title: “There's only one choice when you're in Istanbul...and it's May hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaztheDon
Reviews.Content: This was a thoroughly enjoyable trip made all the better by a brilliant hotel. It's approximately 15 miles from Attaturk airport and the taxi was a reasonable 50 lira, but if you're good at negotiating prices I'm sure you can get it lower.. The staff at the hotel are very welcoming and personable. Any problems we had of finding good places to eat or reccomendations of tourist attractions, they were there to answer all queries. The rooms are very modern and pleasantly furnished with air conditioning. The rooms are clean which is a great credit to the cleaning staff who do a brilliant job. The added bonus is that all rooms have a safe so you can put all your personal documents in there knowing you can be out of the room the whole day and all your important travel items are safe. However the hotel only serve breakfast from 7-10 am. But its a good breakfast with a wide selection of fruits, breads, cereals and hot and cold refreshements. But with that in mind why would you want lunch and supper at the hotel when there are brilliant restaurants just down the road. I really enjoyed this hotel and its all credit to the great staff that work there. And the worst thing about the whole trip....having to leave the hotel and this great city.

Reviews.Title: “This is THE best hotel in Istanbul for the price you pay - you would be mad to go anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: drfaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and it really made our trip. The rooms are spotless (one of the cleanest hotels I've stayed in), the staff extremely friendly and helpful and the location perfect for all the sightseeing. All the main sights are within walking distance. The buffet breakfast was really good with plenty of choice and fresh fruit. Having read the other reviews regarding the room size, the rooms are somewhat small but for the price you pay, you can't expect huge rooms. When we stayed they were just opening up the terrace - a perfect way to end a long day's sightseeing with a drink watching the sunset. All in all I would thoroughly recommend this hotel - will definitely come again!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: frannyDublin
Reviews.Content: Myself my husband and two friends stayed in this excellent friendly hotel from Jul 29th to Aug 2nd. Erol the General Manager and his team were extremly helpful and efficient and made our stay very pleasurable. The hotel is small and compact, very clean and in a perfect location, five mins by car to Sultanhamnet and right next door to the Grand Bazaar. If I return to Istanbul in the future, I will definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly and a good place to be !”
Reviews.Author: gulhas
Reviews.Content: this hotel made our stay in istanbul a memorble one. Friendly staff willing to help us with everything from good advice to tips for a better stay. Clean rooms just what you want after a long hard day. Rooms are small but its in the pice and the open buffet was excellent with over 15 choices. Location ws excellent very close to the historical part. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ceydaBarcelona
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice surprise for travellers to istanbul. This new, cosy warm hotel provided us with everything we could wish for in such a beautiful city. The rooms were immaculate the service great with friendly, staff waiting to help you at every opportunity, breakfast was a feast, and the location was within a few minutes walk to the seafront and the famous open road fish restaurants of Kumkapi within a few metres. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an affordable price with 5 star treatment!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Yellowmonk
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes walk to Grand Bazaar, but the steep slope between the hotel and the bazaar makes you lose half your energy level. 20 minutes walk to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Basilica Cistern, not too far away from the main attractions of Istanbul. The room we were given was tiny! We were rather disappointed to see our neighbour's room much more spacious than ours. But since we only went back to the hotel to shower and sleep, we didn't have much to complain about. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly, just as everyone we met during our trip (except the people working at the airport). Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you do not have any problems walking up steep slopes, and if you are not expecting something luxuriously comfortable.

HotelInfo.Name: May Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Mimar Hayrettin Mah. Bali Pasa Yokusu. No.110 | Kumkapi, Istanbul 34490, Turkey
